column1: A pattern formed by molecules undergoing quantum scattering in an experiemnt at the Vienna Center of Quantum Science and Technology
The experiment demonstrates how massive particles produce interference patterns consistent with the quantum principle of wave-particle duality.
A feature of this experiment is that it shows how such patterns form one particle at a time.
The molecular source utilses a laser that evaporates molecules off a thin molecular coating on a window inside a vacuum chamber.
A 3Î¼m collimation slit filters the molecuels into a narrow beam.

column2: the particles are incident on a grating with 100nm aperture spacing.
the scattered beam is deposited on a target window where the molecules are illumated by an infrared laser.

column1: Under the infrared laser the deposited molecules fluoresce
column2: and the resulting pattern is imaged by a CCD camera.
